reviews.text: Very hard working young staff who deserve credit. They need to improve their reservation software as they were unable to find my booking when we arrived. Excellent food

Best for: groups, special dinners, food lovers who appreciate presentation and interesting Chinese/Asian fusion dishes.

What to try: Definitely the Peking duck. If you have room, the lamb skewers and beef rib/crust dishes get strong mentions.

Tips: Go early or make a reservation to avoid long waits. Donâ€™t expect a luxe ambiance â€” the focus is more on the food than the interior.

Expectations: Youâ€™ll likely get excellent food for the price, but itâ€™s not fine-dining luxury nor low-cost casual; expect a mid-to-upper price range in Manhattan.
ç‰¹åˆ«å–œæ¬¢é…¥é¥¼ç½ç„–ç‰›è…©ï¼Œç‰›è…©ç„–çš„è½¯çƒ‚ï¼Œåˆæœ‰æ»‹å‘³ï¼æµ·å‚ä¹Ÿå¾ˆä¸é”™ï¼Œä¸‹é¥­ï¼

I've been looking for this Peking duck for 25 years, ever since my homeown's best Chinese restaurant closed when the owners retired. I've eaten duck in Alexandria, San Francisco,  and even Beijing, and never found it prepared as perfectly as it is here.

Paper-thin pancakes, hoisin, green onion,  and, of course, that beautiful duck, with crispy skin, rich fat, and perfectly roasted meat. I'm glad I didn't find this place earlier in my visit, or I just would have come back here every night.

The service is quick and attentive. The dining room is clean, but the decor is somehow both sterile and gaudy.  Still, the food more than makes up for any other shortcomings.
Very tasty with a little modern flair! The lamb skewers were our highlight with the Peking duck as 2nd. Everything was very tasty and food was quick.

I was walking home from work with my partner and we werenâ€™t even that hungry, but we havenâ€™t had good packing duck in the city and once we saw this place busy cute with an amazing name we knew we had to go in

The service was great. They couldnâ€™t see right away, but it was a short 10 minute wait the staff is very attentive very on top of it.

We werenâ€™t hungry, so we just ordered only the Peking Duk however everything looked so good. I want to order so much more but trying to eat later these days.

We also ordered a side of duck soup, which was only two dollars

Everything hit all the right spots the soup and the pecking duck were absolutely perfect. I loved everything so much that will go back and I wanna go back and try other things and maybe even order more duck. I canâ€™t express how happy I am but itâ€™s on my overall happiness listso five stars all the way go try this place out.
Very nice restaurant. The Peking duck was perfect. Quiet, clean with perfect service. Thank you. Will come back.
One of my fav Chinese restaurants. The Peking duck and grilled bass is a must!
Excellent food - specially the PekÃ­n Duck. We will come back for sure .

Great for party or celebration.  The private room can well fit over 10 people without feeling crowded.
Unfortunately I didn't take enjoy photos but I shall say the food appeals both Chinese and American's palate.
The rib Wellington is a kill and we ended up ordered 2!
The dessert (ice cream!)  is a bit too realistic but taste very good!
Chef Huang is really a good place for dining. All the dishes are good.
Fantastic food, too bad we didn't get to taste the steam fish.
I like duckâ€™s meat, and I love Pekin duck recipe. I tried it before and it got stuck in my mind. I did enjoyed it here. Weâ€™ll come back

Amazing food, had the Fried Rice and the Animal Ice Cream.

The Animal Ice Cream was extremely detailed and the fried rice contained a perfect mix off all ingredients.

Would definitely recommend to anyone!
Excellent duck and dumplings. Hospitable and efficient service. Reasonably priced. A new favorite for me

The food is really good. One of the best examples of Peking duck we've ever had.

Popular restaurant and great service as well.

Chef Huang is truly a hidden gem in the neighborhood.
We had the Peking duck, sea cucumber, lamb skewers, spicy crawfish, and steamed marble goby, and every single dish was nothing short of outstanding.The Peking duck absolutely lives up to its reputation as the best in New Yorkâ€”perfectly crisp skin, tender meat, and expertly carved and served.The spicy crawfish was bursting with flavor, with just the right level of heatâ€”inviting rather than overpowering.
The steamed marble goby was incredibly delicate and fresh, with the fish cooked just right to retain its natural sweetness.The lamb skewers were juicy and aromatic, with a beautiful balance of spices that lingered just enough to make you crave more.The braised sea cucumber was a true standoutâ€”silky, rich, and deeply savory, showcasing the chefâ€™s masterful technique.
Itâ€™s clear that the chef understands these ingredients deeply. Saying the dishes taste "just like in China" doesnâ€™t do them justiceâ€”Chef Huang has gone beyond whatâ€™s considered authentic and instead focused on unlocking the full potential of each ingredientâ€™s natural flavor.
When I saw the accolades at the entranceâ€”"Restaurant of the Year" and "Chef of the Year" by a major Chinese culinary mediaâ€”I was not surprised. In fact, I believe Chef Huangâ€™s restaurant easily rivals, if not surpasses, several Chinese restaurants recently featured in the New York Timesâ€™ Top 100 or other English-language food media. In terms of flavor, craftsmanship, and overall experience, this place is in a league of its own.
Everything is perfect and presented with dedication. Everything, no matter food or the environment, is highly recommended, will definitely come back again.

Not what I expected from the reviews. Went with the family just to try the Peking duck. Disappointedâ€¦

Really good: lobster (got it scallion/ginger style--a little different than usual canto style, but flavors were really good), house special lamb kebabs (juicy!), steamed live fish (small and expensive, but delicious), pea shoots (pretty standard tbh, but standard pea shoots is really good for me)
Pretty good: Peking duck
Average: Beef ribs with crispy crust (some pieces were better than others)
Below average: Braised beef brisket with crispy pancake (beef was extremely dry)
Extremely bad: Dungeness crab

I deducted two stars for the Dungeness crab because I'm really frustrated they served that to us. We pre-ordered the crab (along with the lobster and fish) a day ahead. The day of, we wanted the crab scallion ginger style but the waiter came back after we ordered and was like the chef said no--we had to get it either HK style or hot spicy. We found that a little weird, but sure, we got it HK style instead. When the crab came, it was obvious why. The crab was not fresh. The meat was extremely mushy and flavorless. For something that cost over $80 and that we pre-ordered, there was really no excuse for that. (Also, I would not recommend their version of HK style; scallion ginger was a lot better).
Very good dishes!

å‘³é“ä¸é”™ï¼ŒåŒ…è£…æ„Ÿè§‰å¹²å‡€å«ç”Ÿï¼Œå¤–å–å°å“¥é€é¤é€Ÿåº¦å¿«ï¼ŒåŠæ—¶é€è¾¾ï¼Œç”µè¯æ²Ÿé€šè¯­è¨€å’Œå–„ï¼ŒåŒæ ·è¦å†™ä¸Šé¤ç›’åˆ°æ‰‹åå¤–è§‚æ²¡æœ‰å—åˆ°æŸåã€‚ç»“æœæ˜¯æ„Ÿè§‰æ¯”æƒ³è±¡ä¸­ä»¤äººæ»¡æ„ï¼Œå‘³é“ç¾æ

Cozy but with a great ambiance and absolutely delicious food. I recommend specifically a famous Pekin duck ğŸ¦†
That spot would become one of your fav as it became mine ğŸ¥°ğŸ˜ thank you ğŸ™
really great food! The duck and the veggies are delicious. Definitely worth the visit
Amazing little gem. Friendly staff, fresh delicious food

Very good Peking duck. Best in the area.

The soup dumplings werenâ€™t too bad but just average overall.

The fried fish was excellent. Perfectly crispy.

The rice bowls are massive to be sure to share.

It gets extremely busy for very limited staff so service can take long. It was also extremely hot inside.
Compliments to the chef ! The duck soup, pecking duck and fried rice were excellent ! Service impeccable. I am so happy I made the decision to eat dinner there tonight.

I cannot remember enjoying a meal this delicious, from the Spring Rolls to the duck! Whatever the chef did in preparing our meal was nothing short of AMAZING. I am a long term COVID patient. Since the first round, I had lost both smell and taste. Fast forward six years, I regained about 75% smell and 60% taste. My first bite of Spring Roll was an experience Iâ€™ve not had in SIX years! I actually tasted individual ingredients!!! This happened for EVERY bite of food I had. I was embarrassing myself because I truly thought I would never again taste food so fully again, and I could not contain my amazement. What is somewhat unbelievable is that it is lasting as the next evening I went out and ordered scallops at a French restaurant. I literally smelled them as they came out of the kitchen, and I was far from the kitchen and could not see them bringing things out. If my travels take me anywhere near Manhattan, I will ALWAYS stop there for a meal. THANK YOU, Chef Huangâ€™s.
Husband has been wanting to try peking duck since 2 years ago. This place was a last-minute decision the evening before valentines Day. Glad we did!
really good peking duck, others were really yummm too
Everything is delicious and the staff are friendly. Thanks for two great meals!

The only way to celebrate Chinese New Year (Lunar New Year for all you PC folks) is with a big group, so that's what we did at Chef Huang.

'Twas 'sokay.

We got a lot of food, so I won't laundry list everything, just group them for your reviewing pleasure:

The Great: House Special BBQ Lamb Kebab (so good we got it twice))

The Good: Pork Ribs Shanghai Style, Crispy Salt Roasted Boneless Sea Bass, Sauteed Pea Shoots with Garlic, Fried Sweet Tang Yuan

The Meh: Mashed Garlic Cucumbers, Sauteed Shanghai Vegetables with Garlic
House Special Noodles, House Special Big Mouth Bass with Vegetables, Chef Special Crispy Boneless Chicken Steak (suuuuper dry), Animal Ice-Cream (not chocolate, boo!)

Bottom line: It's not bad if you're in the area, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.
Best roasted duck in town
The food was alright but the Peking duck was good. The servers were really nice and apologized for not having some items. The atmosphere was casual and nice.

Iâ€™m an appetizer eater: dumplings, yum, greens, good if pricey, scallion pancakes, not good at all, dry, not the comfort food one looks for in scallion pancakes. Bummer, made the meal sorta disappointing.
Great taste and service. Will come back.
Good neighbor Chinese restaurant. Good quality of food and friendly service.

I been to this restaurant so many times and it is my favorite chinese restaurant in New York. The Beijing duck tasted like home and so many other good dishes. The owners are always so nice to me. Highly recommend. I love the lamb skewers, Peking duck, and the braised beef brisket. Everyone needs
to try.

I can tell a chefâ€™s personality from their food and Chef Huang must be a fun and interesting guy filled with new and quirky ideas. Because his food is not only delicious but also FUN to look at! They are like a fascinating toy that makes you marvel at the idea and the brilliant execution behind it.
Cucumber salad is 11/10

Peking duck, scallion pancakes, beef ribs, pea shoots, bok choy, mapo tofuâ€¦.you name it! This place is THE best! Everything we had was over the top delicious and the staff couldnâ€™t have been more friendly & accommodating.
è¿™æ˜¯ä¸€å®¶ä½è°ƒç¾å‘³ä¸”å®æƒ çš„å®è—ä¸­é¤é¦†ï¼
éå¸¸å¥½åƒï¼ï¼ï¼èœå“ç¾å‘³ï¼Œç¯å¢ƒå¯çˆ±ï¼Œè€æ¿å¨˜å’Œåº—å‘˜éƒ½å¾ˆçƒ­æƒ…è®¤çœŸã€‚å¿…é¡»æ»¡åˆ†å¥½è¯„ï½ï½

amazing lamb hotpot and Peking duck!
the only thing that can be better is that the rice is too soggy
Had the fried rice, noodles and pork ribs. Unfortunately most of the food was pretty oily and the meat in all the dishes were very dry.
Food was delicious.  Scallion pancakes and beef kabobs outstanding.  Loved the Peking Duck as well.  Only thing missing were the duck drumsticks-my favourite!

This is one of my dadâ€™s favorite restaurants and he wanted to have his birthday dinner here. I called and made same day reservations, requested 7:30 but was offered 8:15. We got to the restaurant around 8, there is street parking to be found in the area after 7pm. It was my first time hereâ€¦the restaurant is cute but tinyâ€¦7 tables in total and one additional table in a private room..expect a lengthy waitâ€¦it was a bit disappointing that even with the reservations we actually didnâ€™t get our table until 9, which means we were sitting around waiting for an hour, not ideal especially with little ones! The staff did their best to accommodate, and put our order in while we were waiting so that our food arrived shortly after we sat down, which was amazing given that we were starving by then. We got the table in the back in the private room and itâ€™s a great place for a celebration. The food was worth the wait!! The duck was amazing, definitely the highlight hereâ€¦crispy skin, tender meatâ€¦really good flavor! My son loved the soup dumplingsâ€¦The scallion pancake was less oily than what I am used to but nothing special. Would recommend the mashed garlic cucumber as an accompaniment: so yum, we should have ordered two!! The beef ribs with crispy crust were good but heavyâ€¦really tasty with the pineapple on the side. Dessert was delicious too and really fun for the kids we had the chocolate ice cream shaped as different animals. My 9 year old proclaimed this was the best meal sheâ€™s ever had and she loves to eat out so that says a lot! Not the best meal Iâ€™ve ever had but I would definitely be back for their duckâ€¦wouldnâ€™t bother making reservations next time and would just walk in expecting a long wait. Overall great dinner experience, worth the wait!

We came here to celebrate for my brother's birthday. We heard about the Peking duck from friends, and it was amazing! Our waitress was super nice and friendly. The interior and environment of the place was really comfortable and well decorated. The animal ice cream was also just like the pictures, and tasted super good. Everything we ordered was great, definitely going to come again!!

Best Peking duck in town!
The ambience was spot-on, and the food, Unreal. Everything was house made. The Peking duck and Chinese-style beef Wellington were absolute standouts. But here's the kicker: pairing them with the Nicolis Amarone recommended by the owner, took it to a whole new levelâ€¦Already counting down the days till our next visit!

Best Peking duck in the city! Love this place, my girlfriend and I eat here a few times a month. The staff is friendly, attentive, and great, they always hook us up with fun extras. Hands down the best duck youâ€™ll get in the city. I always start with a fresh guava juice, which is killer and so fresh. Aside from the duck, the chefâ€™s special beef rib with crispy crust is a MUST. It takes them 10 hours to prepare and itâ€™s worth every minute. My girlfriend is Chinese and while I am not, we both agree this is the best spot in the city for authentic Chinese cuisine. Pics are the chef special beef rib, mushroom appetizer, Peking duck, pork bun, Guava juice. All amazing! Love this place!

Food was excellent! Peking duck is definitely one of the best I have tried in the city, and we certainly ordered too many dishes just for two, even a whole duck, and we finished most of it! Unlimited duck soup is the best part, we both had three bowls each. So delicious! Highly recommend this place! Met Chef Huang's wife, extremely beautiful person outside and inside. Please come and support this newly open restaurant!

Hands down the best Peking duck I've had in the U.S.! As someone from Beijing, I think the Peking duck here is the closest to the ones I've had in Beijing. ğŸ¦† I've tried several places in New York and the Bay Area, but nothing compares to the quality here.

The duck is incredibly juicy and crispy, with perfectly caramelized skin that shatters with each bite, revealing tender and savory meat underneath. The flavor and texture are so rich and satisfying. Each bite melts in your mouth ğŸ˜‹

The duck is served with delicate pancakes, fresh scallions, and a tangy-sweet hoisin sauce. The balance of crispy skin, succulent meat, and vibrant condiments creates a symphony of flavors that is both satisfying and addictive. ğŸ¥¢âœ¨

Whether you're a Peking duck aficionado or simply love great food, Chef Huang's is a must-visit spot for Peking duck. Savor each moment of a beautifully crafted meal that leaves a lasting impression. ğŸ½ï¸

Delicious! I was told this restaurant opened not too long ago and it did not disappoint. The wraps for the Peking duck were so thin and authentic. My only wish is that they give more of the cucumbers and scallions to add into the wrap, but no big deal. The beef ribs in crispy pancakes were AMAZING. The beef ribs were so tender and highly suggest that as a possible starter. Highly recommend the Peking duck, soup dumplings, chefâ€™s special beef ribs with crispy pancake and lamb skewers, and house special noodles. They also give a complimentary soup when you order the Peking duck. Hopefully Iâ€™ll be back! I also recommend making a reservation because it does get busy.

My family and I have been visiting this place for so many times. Chef Huang also surprised us with his amazing and authentic food! We tried all the dishes there. Everything worth trying! We also befriended Summer there who has always been so friendly, welcoming and kind! Top notch food and friendly hospitalityğŸ¥° My faves are roasted duck and Lamb stew!

Rare Peking duck feast with the actual correct wraps instead of baos! Cozy restaurant, great food and service, highly recommend. The cold appetizer gluten dish is a hidden gem on the menu. All the dishes were delicious. The duck came with soup, which was slightly on the fattier side - we were too full to finish it anyway.

çƒ¤é¸­å¾ˆé¦™å¾ˆå¥½åƒã€‚ç…§ç†è¯´ç‚¹äº†æ•´åªçš„åº”è¯¥æŠŠä½™ä¸‹çš„é¸­æ¶ç»™åšäº†æ¤’ç›ä½œä¸ºå¦å¤–çš„èœä¸Šçš„ï¼Œå¯æƒœæ²¡è¿™ä¸ªé€‰é¡¹ï¼Œåªæ˜¯é€äº†é¸­æ±¤ã€‚

åˆ†é‡ä¸­ç­‰åå°‘ï¼Œæ²¡å¤ªåƒé¥±ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬å¤§éƒ¨åˆ†å±äºé£Ÿé‡åå¤§çš„ï¼Œå¯èƒ½å¾—å¤šç‚¹ä¸€äº›ä¸»é£Ÿã€‚

æ€»ä½“å‘³é“éƒ½ä¸é”™ï¼Œéƒ½æ²¡è¸©é›·ã€‚æœåŠ¡å‘˜ä¸‡å¹´å«ä¸åˆ°ï¼Œä¸Šäº†èœå°±èº²å¨æˆ¿äº†ä¸€æ ·ã€‚

I recently had an exceptional dining experience at Chief Huang. The whimsical ice cream shaped like a dog is as cute as it is delicious. But the real star of the show has to be the grilled lamb skewers â€“ hands down the best and most affordable in the city! The Peking duck also offers fantastic value without compromising on quality. This place is a gem, especially for families, as they are incredibly kid-friendly. Itâ€™s rare to find such top-notch service in New York, and I wholeheartedly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a memorable meal.

This is very nice place in kips Bay right North of 34 the St. It's a small restaurant but it is clean the chairs are comfortable the atmosphere is very communal. You have round tables with the rotating table too for allowing sharing food. The for came out very quick. The signature nice is the duck ğŸ¦† it was cooked very well tender and juicy. The BBQ beef was also good it was very tender meat. The beef in the pot ğŸ² was also flavorful and comforting on a rainy day.

Delicious food and items at an affordable price point in NYC. Great value for money addition to the Chinese options, especially for Peking duck. Other must-trys are the skewers, and the charcoal presentation and addition brings a new flair to upscale Chinese cuisine. Will visit again

This place specializes in bbq-inspired Chinese. We loved it.

The Peking duck was as good as it gets outside of China. Lamb skewers were tender, fatty, and well seasoned. The highlight was the beef brisket roll. Not quite sure how authentically Chinese it is (it probably is and Iâ€™ve just never had it), but it was so tasty - reminded me of a beef Wellington.

The veggie dishes (Mapo tofu, pea shoots), though not the highlights, were also great.

Highly recommended.

So glad to have finally tried Chef Huang! Tiny and cozy place with friendly staffs. Unique dishes but we only managed to order 2 (Special Beef Rib and Peking Duck) given we were a party of 2. The ribs were divine but was disappointed with the duck as the meat was quite dry (hence the one star deduction). Overall great quality, pricing understandable given its quality and definitely an excuse for a bigger group to try rest of the menu.

The BeiJing duck was well spiced and sliced. While the staff provided supplementary vegetables and wraps whenever we ran out, the wraps were quite thin and often stuck to each other, making the experience difficult.

The lamb hot pot was quite spicy as it had claimed to be. I enjoyed the various cuts. The basket of vegetables were a nice pairing.

Came here for Lunar New Year lunch and ordered a whole Peking duck (but very fatty - look in my pic), the pastry wrapped beef ribs were insanely good, shrimp fried rice was very good, sautÃ©ed veggies were good, lamb skewers were best Iâ€™ve had anywhere, veggies with dry bean curd and edamame was good, and beef pot pie with pastry on top was good. Oh, and the dog shaped ice cream freaked all of us out. It was too realistic when we cut the head off with our spoons.

The service was fine and quick. The awkward part was 6 of us at a table ordering a lot of food only to have no room for the plates. Example: they brought out a big plate for rice when it couldâ€™ve been a bowl. The Peking duck was brought out on a large display case when it needed to be a regular plate.

So, in conclusion, the food was very good except the duck - not worth the $80 - far too fatty. All other good was good! The display of food on the table was awkward and too much for show. It needs to be simplified.

4.1/5
The best Peking Duck in the city! My new to to to place in midtown. Very reasonable price with decent food, bring traditional Chinese dishes into the new fusion style. 5 stars recommend!

Visited here for the fusion - Chinese style Beef Wilington, itâ€™s simply delicious with beef sirloin, not traditional steak version. Peking duck is also yummy, crispy duck skin and tender duck meat, very authentic! They also provided a good service, but like a cozy family restaurant.

Visited here with a friend during what seemed like a slow lunch for the place. There was only one other large group when we arrived. We ordered the half peking duck, lamb kebabs and vegetable fried noodles. Honestly, this might've been one of the best peking ducks I've had. The duck was flavorful and the meat was juicy. The wrappers were as thin as crepes and for just half a duck, they gave more than enough for 2 people to share. I think I'm a fan of kebabs as the lamb kebabs here were tender and well seasoned. It came as 5 skewers over a small stone grill with 3 pieces on each stick. The vegetable fried noodles were a pretty big portion as well, next time I think I'll try the meat versions of this dish as it felt like something was misssing from the flavor profile...seafood or scallops would've been a great addition.

The server was quietly attentive in refilling our water glasses through out our meal.

The decor here doesn't really match what's on the menu. It gives off a French bakery vibe, both the exterior and interior.

Restrooms are downstairs and have the decor of a flower garden.

Last week, my friend and I went to chef huang restaurant for dinner and ordered their most popular Peking duck. The skin of the roast duck is crispy and soft, and the meat is tender. It tastes great with the special sauce and rolls! Soâ€¦

So first of all really good Peking duck, absolutely come and order it. Will definitely return just for that and the duck broth that came with it.

But just for fun I ordered the animal shaped chocolate ice cream.

â€¦

Donâ€™t order the animal shaped chocolate ice cream. It tastes like (and has the consistency of) refrigerated rubber that was in the same room as a piece of chocolate

PS youâ€™re a psychopath if you eat the head first

A new Chinese restaurant. They don't serve traditional Chinese or American style Chinese food. Instead, their dishes are more of a fusion. Very creative and tastes good.

Recommend: wine marinated raw crab, Peking duck, braised beef with crispy pancake, and lamb kabob. I also recommend ribeye with crispy pancake - it's like a rib style of beef Wellington.

Reservations not needed for weekday dinner but wait can be around 15 min. Small dining area. Service can definitely improve.

My Chinese friends introduced me to this authentic restaurant and i will be back even if i am normally chinese cuisine is not my 1st choice. It is low key and no thrills (but with nice ambiance), far from tourist traps of Chinatown,but the food + hospitality are beyond wonderful. Also highly instagrammable foaming sanitizer thing! Must try their Peking duck, lamb skewers, chiken pot pie, fried lobster, coffee ice cream dessert (and so much more, I just don't remember dishes names).
The back room is perfect for a 10-15  people party.

Really delicious and efficient!! The bubbling sanitizer and the chest for the crispy beef rib/Wellington was cute/curious, but everything really delicious - especially the Peking Duck! Would recommend especially since in addition to the flavours, the staff was also very kind.

I had an exceptional evening at Chef Huang, an upscale Chinese restaurant, hidden on 2nd Ave and 34th St.

This humble restaurant serves some amazing, creative, upscale, Chinese culinary delights in an elegant environment with a great, personalized, service, and a great vibe.

This is definitely not your Grandpa Chinese, unless your Grandpa was the Emperor of China

A hidden Gem ğŸ’

One of the best peking ducks I had. Definitely a must order. The duck meat was juicy and tender with the glassily crispy skin on top. Together with the pancake, scallion whites, and the sauce, everything just melted in my mouth. I canâ€™t wait to go back again!

Disclaimer: some of the dish can be a tad too salty/flavorful but as long as you order the duck you will be left satisfied.

The first time I came here, I was amazed by the chef's exquisite culinary skills. The ingredients were of high quality. The service was enthusiastic and attentive.The dining atmosphere, although the restaurant is not very large, is very pleasant and cozy. I highly recommend everyone to come and try this restaurant.

Best Peking Duck in town. I love Peking Duck and have tried various restaurants in Midtown and Chinatown. Oddly enough, Chef Huang beats them all. Theyâ€™re pancakes are thin and stretchy, and the scallions are razor thin. Itâ€™s high class. To top it off, the people who run this place are SO nice. Always greet me with a smile, and happy to squeeze we in even when theyâ€™re really busy.

Iâ€™m moving to another neighborhood soon, but will come back for this duck. Itâ€™s just so good!

I saw the restaurant had a $10 lunch special with 3 meats(braised beef with potatoes, chicken broccoli and mapo tofu) served with white rice and duck soup. There were no menus at the time and the QR code outside just lead to their website that had a few random pictures of food and the chef. The kitchen is downstairs out of view. While making my order they informed me that they ran out of everything except the braised beef with potatoes so they gave me that with the soup but promised itâ€™d be extra meat. Eating this was a disappointment. The rice tasted exactly like when I add too much water to my rice cooker, the beef was bland and the soup only vaguely tasted like duck. The potatoes were probably the best part about this dish. I had a hard time finishing this meal, it was mostly rice with 2 spoons of beef. Certainly donâ€™t see any reason to ever go back here.
Incredible flavors! Got the black pepper skewers and the mushroom appetizer (favorite) and am very happy with both. Staff were nice and the restaurant is clean and nice.
